_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: FrankenPHP
author: sinaloensemel@gmail.com

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# FrankenPHP Installation Script
#

# Create Caddy directory
mkdir -p /mnt/server/caddy

# Create PHP conf.d directory
mkdir -p /mnt/server/php/conf.d

# Create PHP logs directory
mkdir -p /mnt/server/php/logs

# Create public directory
mkdir -p /mnt/server/public


# Caddyfile
cat > /mnt/server/caddy/Caddyfile << 'EOF'
(common_log_filter) {
    request>remote_ip delete
    request>remote_port delete
    request>proto delete
    request>headers delete

    resp_headers delete
    user_id delete
}

{
    servers {
        trusted_proxies static 172.18.0.0/16 fdba:17c8:6c94::/64
    }
    
    log caddy-console {
    	level INFO
        output stderr
        
        format filter {
        	import common_log_filter
            
            wrap console {
            	time_format iso8601
            }
        }
    }
    
    log caddy-file {
    	level WARN
        format json
        output file /home/container/caddy/logs/caddy.log
    }
}

:80 {
    root * /home/container/public
    php_server
    
    log file {
    	level INFO
        #format json
        output file /home/container/caddy/logs/access.log
        
        format filter {
        	import common_log_filter
            
            wrap json {
                time_format iso8601
            }
        }
    }
}
EOF



# Replace Caddyfile
sed -i "s#^:80 {#:$SERVER_PORT {#" /mnt/server/caddy/Caddyfile




#### PHP ###
# 99-custom.ini
cat > /mnt/server/php/conf.d/99-custom.ini << 'EOF'
; Maximum amount of time each script may spend parsing request data. It's a good
; idea to limit this time on productions servers in order to eliminate unexpectedly
; long running scripts.
; Note: This directive is hardcoded to -1 for the CLI SAPI
; Default Value: -1 (Unlimited)
; Development Value: 60 (60 seconds)
; Production Value: 60 (60 seconds)
; https://php.net/max-input-time
max_input_time = 10

; Maximum amount of memory a script may consume
; https://php.net/memory-limit
memory_limit = 128M

; Maximum size of POST data that PHP will accept.
; Its value may be 0 to disable the limit. It is ignored if POST data reading
; is disabled through enable_post_data_reading.
; http://php.net/post-max-size
post_max_size = 8M

; Maximum allowed size for uploaded files.
; http://php.net/upload-max-filesize
upload_max_filesize = 2M



; This directive controls whether or not and where PHP will output errors,
; notices and warnings too. Error output is very useful during development, but
; it could be very dangerous in production environments. Depending on the code
; which is triggering the error, sensitive information could potentially leak
; out of your application such as database usernames and passwords or worse.
; For production environments, we recommend logging errors rather than
; sending them to STDOUT.
; Possible Values:
;   Off = Do not display any errors
;   stderr = Display errors to STDERR (affects only CGI/CLI binaries!)
;   On or stdout = Display errors to STDOUT
; Default Value: On
; Development Value: On
; Production Value: Off
; https://php.net/display-errors
display_errors = Off

; Log errors to specified file. PHP's default behavior is to leave this value
; empty.
; https://php.net/error-log
; Example:
error_log = "/home/container/php/logs/php_errors.log"
EOF

# php-info.php
cat > /mnt/server/public/php-info.php << 'EOF'
<?php
phpinfo();
EOF
